SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Interface BeanValueProcessor<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the bean containing the value to be processed
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface BeanValueProcessor<T>
Used to selectively modify values within a batch of JavaBeans or records. A BeanValueProcessor can be "plugged into" batch inserts to apply last-minute transformations on the beans or records, just before they are saved to the database. Although it allows you to apply any transformations you like, its main purpose is to enable you to generate SQL expressions from bean values. Klojang JDBC does not aim to be a SQL parser, and hence it does not know if and how to escape the parts making up the expression. If you want to return a SQLExpression from the process() method, use the provided Quoter to escape and quote strings within the expression. Do not use a BeanValueProcessor just to return a quoted version of the input value. Klojang JDBC already takes care of that. Every value that is saved to the database will (again) go through Quoter.quoteValue(), even it is the return value of BeanValueProcessor.process().
See Also:
  • Quoter
  • BatchInsertBuilder.withValueProcessor(BeanValueProcessor)

  • Method Details

    • identity

      static <U> BeanValueProcessor<U> identity()
      Returns a BeanValueProcessor that returns the input value as-is.
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type of the bean or record containing the value
      Returns:
      a BeanValueProcessor that returns any value passed to it as-is
      See Also:
      • SQLSession.quoteValue(Object)

    • process

      Object process(T bean, String propertyName, Object propertyValue, Quoter quoter)
      Converts the value of a bean property or record component, potentially involving the specified Quoter object.
      Parameters:
      bean - the bean or record containing the value to be converted
      propertyName - the name of the property or record component whose value to convert
      propertyValue - the value to be converted
      quoter - a Quoter to be used if you intend to return an SQLExpression containing string literals
      Returns:
      the converted value
